sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
Signal dangers and deliverances both by land and sea comprehending a short account of the siege of Vienna, one of the most memorable in this last age; together with a description of a violent tempest on the Forth / in two small poems by the same hand. Tyler, Alexander. Tyler, Alexander. Tempest between Burnt-Island and Leith in a boat.
7, 8 p.
Re-printed, [Edinburgh] : 1685.
Attributed by Wing to Alexander Tyler. Place of pulication supplied by Wing. "The tempest between Burnt-Island and Leith in a boat, in November, 1681" has special t.p. and separate pagination. Reproduction of original in the Harvard University Library.
=======

Tyler, Alexander. Tyler, Alexander. Tempest between Burnt-Island and Leith in a boat.
7, 8 p.
Re-printed, [Edinburgh] : 1685.
Attributed by Wing to Alexander Tyler. Place of pulication supplied by Wing. "The tempest between Burnt-Island and Leith in a boat, in November, 1681" has special t.p. and separate pagination. Reproduction of original in the Harvard University Library.
